website_summaries.verdict: All of the basic features most people will want at an affordable price.
pros: Great price, easy to use, strong signal
cons: 50-foot range is short compared to most other remotes

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working and Logitech Won't Replace
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October last year. It worked amazingly. All my classmates have one (PhD program where we give lots of presentations). But, a month ago it just stopped working. My classmate had the same issue. I changed the battery. The lights are on, the red pointer works, but it won't change slides. I tried this on 3 devices. I contacted Logitech and they wouldn't replace/refund the product. I'm disappointed. You "know" they make millions off of their products. Their product support sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Randall

customer_reviews.title: Helpful and Valuable Product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. As a student in business school, we are always doing presentations for class. This simple product has given us such a competitive advantage against other groups, of whom we were graded against. Every professor comments on our professionalism with the clicker. I works perfectly and doesn't require any downloads. It's as easy as plugging it in and clicking away. The only thing I would be weary about is when you use Google Slides. If you don't maximize the presentation screen, sometimes the clicker won't work. It's an easy fix that doesn't make me vote any less than 5 stars on this product
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Be an adult for less than $50
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking at this, you are probably considering whether you need this or not for a professional presentation. Bringing your own presentation clicker makes you look so much more professional than the average person who is fumbling around with the one provided, asking for a laser pointer, or standing at the keyboard, looking down for the "Enter" key every 60 seconds. (Also, this one is Logitech, so you know it works EVERYWHERE.) Be an adult, win the presentation game, all for less than the cost of the beers you would buy people while apologizing for your presentation not going so well, because you decided to "wing it".
customer_reviews.author: TeaPartyHost

customer_reviews.title: No more zippered case!
customer_reviews.text: Solid remote presenter. No complaints there at all - have literally a couple dozen of them floating around. Leaving a review to subtract stars because you no longer get the nice, fit to size, zippered, storage pouch for the remote. You now get a cheap drawstring pouch that doesn't stay closed and serves about the same purpose as a paper bag. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kintz

customer_reviews.title: Would be really nice - if it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I avoided the "better newer" versions which have GREEN lasers because my experience w green lasers is that viewers go blind after only brief use (especially if very reflective surface). So this one is red and better suited to night vision eye properties. (Who's idea was GREEN? Goes against all physiology). So this is, to the observer, the better (of laser color, not better than the circle or mag pointer thingy). Only one minor problem. In WIndows10 didn't work at all. Oops. Hmmmm Many tries by many hands... no go. The web site is a study in simplicity (translate: no help at all).
customer_reviews.author: Newlpost

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Pointer for my high school classroom. We started using it towards the end of the year for our presentations and it worked fine. Now we are back in the fall and I was able to use it two times before it stopped working. I’ve change the batteries to no avail. This feels like a totally wasted purchase. I would like to get my money back but I’m sure it’s past that time period. Or have the item replaced maybe it’s a dud. I think being able to use a pointer 30 to 40 times and have it stop working is extremely frustrating and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JAG

customer_reviews.title: Good depending on what you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: Would I recommend buying this product? Well yes and no, depending on who you are and what you want it for, read on. I would recommend this product because of its price and ease of use. If you just want something cheap and works super easy (just plug-in and go) then this might be the one for you. Don't expect anything fancy with super high-tech functionality. It feels kinda cheap but hey it does its job with no problems. There's one button which I couldn't get to work on mac but maybe it's just me. I would not recommend this to a professional presenter who will need to use it regularly and wants added functionality. Go for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Aristidou

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my thesis defense!
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed for my master's thesis defense presentation. It is perfect for speaking in front of an audience and seamlessly advancing slides...no more awkward hovering over the laptop! The red laser is just an added plus, but refrain from too much pointing and circling with it as it gets dizzying.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Reliable, Nice Fit in Hand
customer_reviews.text: It works simply and reliably. It fits nicely in my hand, and it has a little bit of weight to it. Runs on two AAA batteries (included). The USB receiver can be stored inside the unit, and a fabric drawstring bag is included for storage. There's an on/off switch on the side to save the battery when not in use. In addition to the forward, back, and laser pointer buttons, there are two other buttons. The purpose or function of these buttons is not self-evident, and they are not mentioned in the included instructions. They seem to close windows, but I'm still not precisely sure what they do or why they are on the remote.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL D PEARCE

customer_reviews.title: Very handy all in one control!
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easy to control a PowerPoint presentation without standing right beside the computer. Remote stores inside control. Only drawback is that the laser point is marked with a dull red symbol while all other controls are larger and white. When using it, one needs to look at the remote to ensure you are hitting the right button. It would be easier if the laser pointer symbol was also white if you are working in a subdued lighting environment. Practice will develop the skill to find the right button
customer_reviews.author: RVer Surface user

customer_reviews.title: Worked seamlessly
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I buy a product like this I worry about it working. With so many products, laptops, PCs, software systems etc issues can pop up. This was absolute perfection. I have used it on several different set-ups and its literally plug and play. No thought to anything or any issues. And I like the fact that the little USB plug is stored in the hand unit. It it wasn't I would have lost it or left it somewhere for sure. Well done product, worry free, works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Will Kalif

customer_reviews.title: Quality pointer with nice features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work with my Mac Book. It works flawlessly and has a great feel to it. The bag that came with mine is slightly different than some of those pictured in the review section, but is nice and keeps the pointer from getting too banged up or dirty in my bag. A lot of these pointers that have on board storage of the usb dongle/receiver, can be tedious to remove the dongle. I find this ones stays in well, but is very easy to grip and remove. If they could include a green laser at this price, it would be hard to beat for the money. It's still a great deal for a well-made pointer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Ergonomic Design, Nice Feel BUT NOT Reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Returning. We do PowerPoint Bible studies and needed a reliable remote. THIS IS NOT reliable! It freezes up or skips several slides when you aren't even touching the button. I'm very sad because I love the way this feel in my had and the ergonomic design but we can't have these kinds of problems. We borrowed one from a friend and his is a different brand and had no trouble. So this is going back and we're buying a Honeywell.
customer_reviews.author: Dlea

customer_reviews.title: I loved it. It worked from any angle so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using pointers for 10 years. The one I was using most recently finally died. It only lasted a year. My student had this one, I loved it. It worked from any angle so I ordered it. Received it quickly but could not get it to work. I even purchased new batteries. I used all of the trouble shooting steps and it would not work. So I returned it. I am hoping that it was just a lemon and not reflective of the product in general. It is a nice pointer, comes with case and everything. I went back to my Kensington.
customer_reviews.author: EPTXGAL

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Everything would be perfect if it were not for the ridiculously long USB port plug in. I have worked with several presenters before and each had a usb plug in that was able to simply be left in the laptop which is helpful when presentations must be given frequently. While accessing and storing the old usb thumb drive style plug in is easy, it’s completely unnecessary to have something so big sticking out of the side of the laptop. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Your search ends here, buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great, it does take a few minutes to sync with your computer the first time but after that it's quick and easy. The pointer is bright and works great as well. I like this over some other options because of the fact it has replaceable AAA batteries, I've had USB chargeable ones that seem to have weak batteries. I also love the black screen option for the start of presentations.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Buttons are way too small and close
customer_reviews.text: A very solid product. Bright laser pointer and good quality rubberized body. However, one feature is very annoying - these buttons are too small and spaced too closely. I'm a petite woman with small/fine fingers. Still I have troubles pressing the laser button without accidentally advancing slides. I was considering returning it before I lost it. So I go back to using a ~$9 device with similar functions. That one is not as well made (and the cover of the battery compartment broke off in the second month of use) but I have never had issues with pressing the right buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe H

customer_reviews.title: Great companion for PowerPoint but Laser is too small.
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech Presenter R400 is a great addition for PPT presentations. I really enjoy the ease of connectivity and the intuitive controls to move back and forth through the slides. The only complaint I have is the laser pointer. The laser point is very small and tight and it's hard to find on the screen due to size and brightness of the small dot. Wish the dot was a little larger. Unfortunately this is why I got the presenter and it was a little disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W. Sumruld

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for work, giving numerous presentations to different groups of people. I’m so glad I purchased this clicker - it allows me to move around the room as I’m giving presentations, taking me away from having to stand by the computer to move through presentation slides. Super easy to use and packs well into the small, soft case provided with it. Fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: Awesome presentation remote
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Presentation remote! Very simple setup, basically just plug and play. Put the USB adapter in your computer, and batteries in the remote itself, and you're ready to go. Open Powerpoint (or your presentation software of choice), and control the presentation right with the remote. There's no need to stand by the computer, this remote has great range. Have been using this remote for quite a while in a church setting and it's still going strong. Also like the fact that it includes a laser pointer to focus audience attention on a certain spot in the presentation. All in all, a great purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, user friendly and works immediately
customer_reviews.text: This is a sleek and user friendly item. It worked immediately upon plugging in. The USB dongle slips into a slot on the pointer handle when not in use (see picture). The pointer has a long range and does not need to be pointed at the computer, so works easily for effortless presentations. I bought this to replace another brand of pointer that has always been temperamental. What a change!!
customer_reviews.author: Giraffe

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to use and everything is plug and play without ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very reliable product that I use for presentations. It's very easy to use and everything is plug and play without needing to install any software. It even has a red laser pointer. The only thing I would like changed is the USB adapter. Even though it neatly slides into the main body for storage, I wish the adapter was smaller like the Logitech universal adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Just a dad

customer_reviews.title: Teacher approved.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second presentation remote I've bought. The first was a cheap knockoff from China which worked well for two years, but sometimes would have to click a few times to change slides and seemed like it ate through batteries really fast. This Logitech has been so much better, I have walked all around my lecture hall and never had a problem with clicking and with the on off switch the batteries last much longer. The material used is also so much more comfortable, not a cheap hard plastic, but actually feels good in your hand. Highly recommended from someone who uses it daily.
customer_reviews.author: WillHenry

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Wireless Presenter because I had used a friend's and was impressed with it. I am still impressed with the size and shape. the reason I gave it four stars is because it does not come with the protective zippered pouch which is shown and came with my friend's Wireless Presenter. I received a cloth pouch which is too small. I will purchase the upgraded protective case but I wish I knew that in advance.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Brien

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I make presentations with Keynote from my MacBook Pro. Older MBP's had a universal Apple remote which I used liberally with my previous ca. -2008 MBP. My 2012 boots 10 times faster -- but no remote. I was going to use an iPhone app but most of those apps have poor reviews. I was making a presentation at a company last month and the HR manager allowed me to use her Logitech. It worked so well that I ordered one for myself on the spot from the Amazon App on my iPhone. I had not known about this item before I borrowed hers. I now use it daily in university teaching and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bevan

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Fast and It Works
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this remote except that there is no "pause" button. I had a presentation that I wanted to be able to stop (it was set to advance on a timer) on a certain slide as a holding slide at a time that I couldn't predict. But this works great as a basic remote and really was plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D.

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Product
customer_reviews.text: Product is Awesome and works perfectly for the Powerpoint Presentations I've been using ever since I've rec'd this unit. Very easy to use and very easy on batteries that I've seen/witnessed thus far! Plug/Play and no issues whatsoever. Red Laser will show very well on almost any surfaces unless you're using an actual TV screen for your presentation and then I'm not sure what works for that usage but, mostly I'm using projector and screen application and it's perfect. Thanks for a Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Plug-and-play, works great, much better than bluetooth options
customer_reviews.text: Literally plug and play - just connect the usb dongle and you're good to go (at least on macOS). Works well with keynote, powerpoint and even preview (for photo slideshows). Doesn't work with google photos :( I've tried a slimmer bluetooth clicker in the past () and it was a bad choice - I had constant issues with pairing, and also with clicking the wrong buttons by mistake because they were too close to each other. This clicker is slightly larger/heavier, but the care-free experience is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: I like that the receiver dongle stores in the handle of ...
customer_reviews.text: When used with Windows 10 laptop, the device is plug and play. I like that the receiver dongle stores in the handle of the device when not in use. I am using it from the back of a 50 ft room and have had no issue with signal reception, even when the transmitter is not pointed at the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: RayClem

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic remote. I have the red laser pointer version ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic remote. I have the red laser pointer version for my high school class, and it works fantastically. It will sync with google slides or power-point flawlessly. I can also use the arrow keys to scroll up or down on a webpage while I am presenting to my class.
customer_reviews.author: P Landgren

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t have a 50’ trajectory
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my classroom. It worked great for a month. After a month, the 50’ no longer applies. It was more like 5’. It was very disappointing and defeated the purpose of me getting this. I tried replacing the batteries numerous times and that didn’t help either.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Plourde

customer_reviews.title: Expect dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a pointer/clicker, but has one fatal flaw: it does not automatically shut off when disconnected, and the ON/OFF switch is ambiguous and confusing. I have had three presentations now where I've gone to use the clicker and found the batteries are dead, because I thought I'd turned it off last time and had failed to do so correctly. If you do buy this, here's a tip: look for the RED marker on the on/off switch to confirm it is off, NOT the GREEN marker.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an older molder Logitech that has seen its best days after 6 years of use. I can't get this one to work to advance slides at all, but the laser light works fine. I've already gotten rid of the packaging so I didn't try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Fay R

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased a few of these over the past couple years. If you are passing it around for all day meetings I would suggest getting two and trading off between presenters. Sometimes the heavy use over a few solid days is too much and they die; otherwise, I’ve been very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Cols mom

customer_reviews.title: More than adequate
customer_reviews.text: This works as expected. In quality, I have come to expect a lot from Logitech and this presenter continued to enforce my satisfaction with the brand. It is not feature rich, but, cradled in the palm, it does offer a good comfortable feel and responsiveness during its use in PowerPoint presentations. The addition of a built in laser pointer enhances its usefulness. The controls are intuitively places and are easily operated by the thumb.It is plug and play, and is fully compatible with PowerPoint programs. As stated it is not feature rich but is more than adequate for most presentation needs. The only thing I would have liked is to have the buttons textured in some way.
customer_reviews.author: melmeister

customer_reviews.title: Freedom
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I have an LCD projector at school (i teach high alschool students) and i love the freedom this gives me to walk around the room while using a PowerPoint presentation. The red beam is great for pointing out details and I love the freedom from my desk this gives me.
customer_reviews.author: LBS

customer_reviews.title: No Unifying Receiver Support but 5 Stars Otherwise
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is good. Responds very quickly, strong, sturdy feel in the hand. It also comes with a padded carrying case and the receiver slips into the remote itself for storage which is nice. The only ding I have on the product is that it doesn't work with the Logitech Unifying receivers. So the same Logitech receiver I have for my mouse and other devices, I have to remove and insert this receiver instead (my laptop has only a single USB slot). So that's a little disappointing. If this worked with the Unifying receiver it would be 5 stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Commmander Twinkles

customer_reviews.title: A great investment piece.
customer_reviews.text: Being in college, I have to do sooooooo many presentations. This has come in so handy in impressing my professors. I've used it with Powerpoint and Google Slides. Both work great! Accidentally left the switch on for over a week and still had good battery when I pulled it out for my next presentation. Would definitely recommend this as an investment piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plug-and-Play; Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I installed (5) of these in close proximity to each other for a temporary conference room setup at a tradeshow at a convention center. They worked flawlessly. I plugged the receivers into the mini-PCs we had deployed in each room and the clickers just worked... They require no training, every user knew how they worked because it is so simple. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It can improve.
customer_reviews.text: It works great like all logitech products. I would have preferred a warning light that shows the device is on, so that it doesn’t use up unnecessary battery life. I would also have preferred more features such as up and down, backward, forward, play, stop, pause buttons also. The pointer is awesome and makes it easy to present.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: FREEDOM from the podium!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for teaching and presentations and it is *exactly* what I wanted. It lets me wander away from my laptop and be near my students, NOT stuck behind the podium just so that I can hit "next slide." I didn't think I'd use the laser pointer feature as much as I do, so I'm grateful to have it. I've also used this on different systems, not just my own laptop. I did a professional presentation in an integrated media classroom where I loaded my presentation onto their console and also plugged in the USB receiver of this clicker, and it worked perfectly. Yet another time that I was very glad I wasn't stuck behind the podium!
customer_reviews.author: Mem

customer_reviews.title: Great to have to give better presentations
customer_reviews.text: This remote presenter does what we need. It can control start, forward, backward, and stop of the presentation. It also has red laser pointer (I wish it could be green). The controller even comes with a nice little bag to protect it, and it fit the controller very well. The size of the controller is perfect, it just fit my hand. But the connector - the little usb thing that plug into the usb port on your computer is a little long in my opinion. It has a length similar to the length of your thumb.
customer_reviews.author: calBear

customer_reviews.title: Updated -- It Works Better Now That I Switched Ports
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this device works fairly well, but the range is not as good/reliable as I had hoped. We use it every Sunday in our church. Even when I'm standing within the specified range, sometimes it takes several clicks to advance a slide. It works very reliably within about 20 feet. Here's an update: I changed to a different USB port on my laptop and this remote now works perfectly from any point within our 400 seat sanctuary. I was using the same port I use to plug into our printer. Now that I'm using a different port, everything works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: EngineersGuideToGod

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: This works great with a Late 2013 27" iMac running Keynote. Kind of disappointed Apple did away with IR and the slim remotes no longer work with iMacs, but this is a great consolation. Nice & small, no finicky bluetooth connections to content with (simple & reliable USB dongle), laser is a nice bonus, and best of all, it works! Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: TPBayAMZN

customer_reviews.title: Smooth out your talks
customer_reviews.text: Want to stop bending over to change your slides on your laptop? Want to direct your audience to exactly what you're talking about on your slides? Just get this laser pointer slide advanced already. This installed itself on my Dell laptop when I inserted the USB, no problems with activation or detection. The intensity of the red pointer is a little weak as compared to the fancier green pointers, but this one is excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless presenter. It will enhance your presentations!
customer_reviews.text: This wireless presenter works great. Very soft touch and wonderful to grip. I love the plug and play feature so it insyalls in a matter of seconds on most devices. Laser is a great feature and very visible even if there is some light around the room. I use it for classroom presentations and allows me to move around the room without any issues. Highly recommended and won't break your bank. Plus Logitech is a wonderful brand I trust. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Tolcat81

customer_reviews.title: Great range
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased a handful of these for our church. They have never failed us. We use it at approximately a 50 foot range with zero lag or issues! The usb stick fits directly into the pointer for easy storage which helps misplacement. Also comes with little storage case. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great remote for Google slides and multiple computers!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I present my Google slide lectures on multiple computers when I teach and this has worked perfectly! Love the little carrying case it comes with. Some Macs come up with an error saying it doesn't recognize it, but then it works perfectly. I didn't realize there was a power switch on the side for a few weeks, but hasn't seemed to drain too much battery power. The only hitch when using it with Google slides is that it won't play any embedded YouTube videos in the presentation: you need to have click those to play.
customer_reviews.author: daisylind

customer_reviews.title: Great presenter
customer_reviews.text: Has all the options I needed and allows me a little more freedom when teaching to my agents. It was a little spendy compared to the cheaper knock off versions but I'll always pay a little more for a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, perfect design to hold in hand while giving presentation. The pointer is red, which is great for people attention and focus during the presentation. USB adapter is quite large, but laptop will not be handled or moved during presentation, so I don't think that is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: DanCod

customer_reviews.title: it works great. The design fits well in my hand and ...
customer_reviews.text: When this presenter works, it works great. The design fits well in my hand and the buttons are easy to press. However, I have had consistent issues with the "plug and play" feature. I have had to download the driver to three separate computers that did not recognize the presenter. Also, this thing eats batteries like nothing else. It may be a coincidence, but I have also had more batteries leak acid in this thing than all my other electronics combined. I would recommend trying another presenter that is more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Use it everyday
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I am not tech savvy at all but as a teacher I use this everyday and it is wonderful. Just slide the USB out and plug it into the presentation computer and you are good to go. Highly recommend. Also the batteries it came with have lasted me the whole school year. Nice perk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year and it works fine, have not had any problems during my presentations. However because I remove the batteries after every use, the battery compartment lid has lost its grip and now barely stays closed. Otherwise I'm happy with the presenter. I used the laser once but it was ineffective, which left me with finger pointing during my presentations.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died in under 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2-3 months. Stopped working after about a dozen uses. While it worked, I would have given it three to four stars. However, since it died so quickly I'm giving it a single star.
customer_reviews.author: Schmeeby

customer_reviews.title: Great little device that fits into the palm of your ...
customer_reviews.text: Great little device that fits into the palm of your hand. The USB clip fits into the device for storage when not being used. The laser pointer works well and the left/right buttons to control a PowerPoint presentation work intuitively well with finger sized buttons designed for real uses. The on/off switch displays green for On and red for Off giving a good reminder to turn off when putting it away, or turn it on to use. It's size is small enough for storage in my bag of gadgets and large enough to hold easily. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Holly H

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool for presentations!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is easy to use, works well, and is inexpensive, what more could you ask? I like that it has buttons for presentation mode and blanking the screen. The laser is bright and positioned well to use. I highly recommend practicing with this, you need to make sure you hit the right buttons! However the intuitive nature of this tool makes for a quick learning curve that leaves you to present heads up and not looking down at a laptop. The only con I have is that the dongle is rather large at over an inch. That could cause a problem at some podiums. Overall though, for the price, this thing is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: William Rice

customer_reviews.title: Presenter saves lecture interruptions
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day in my classroom. I use powerpoint presentations, videos, and this presenter is brilliant. I had one of these in a previous version, and this one is actually better. My classroom is pretty big, and the computer station is off to the side, away from the lecturn; using this presenter helps me keep moving the lecture-presentation forward without having to either lurk at the far side of the class or walk back and forth for every slide change.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Snow

customer_reviews.title: Quality, dependable product allows you to focus completely on your presentation.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pointer works well, even on a Mac computer, thankfully with no setup needed. Simply plug in USB receive into any computer and start pointing with the nicely bright red laser and advancing slides/starting/darkening the presentation with the easy-to -navigate-by-touch buttons. Sometimes the forward/reverse slide buttons require two presses but this is such a minor issue it's almost not even worth considering. Also, button presses provide nice tactile clicking feedback for you the presenter, but do not result in any noticeable clicking sounds for the audience, which is nice. Sleek design and great, reliable functionality make this another high quality Logitech product, which hopefully lasts many years.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Works great - 2 years after purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great little presenter - purchased this after my old one broke two years ago and i haven't had a single issue with this presenter. Quickly connects to computer and I'm able to use it at a distance away without any issues...although, the farthest I've used is 20 feet. I have dropped the device several times without any issues. Seems well built and sturdy enough to withstand the occasional drop. Battery life is great - i use it several hours per week and I have yet to replace the battery. I highly recommend to anyone wishing to use a simple wireless presenter - laser works well too.
customer_reviews.author: owh03

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it so far
customer_reviews.text: Got it this week and used it during my first presentation without a hitch. Easy to install (just plug and play, really) and super simple to use. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Suastegui

customer_reviews.title: A must have for presenting
customer_reviews.text: Wow - no installation required. Easy to flip back and forward through a PPT deck. The red laser pointer is a nice edition along with having the ability to "black out" the presentation you're showing. It never fails when you want to start to talk in detail on something, you'd rather them focus on you and not the slides - this handy feature solves that issue. Definitely priced right (at least when I purchased it...< $30)
customer_reviews.author: M. George

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: No installation needed, just plug and play. These work with desktop and laptop computers. No assembly or hard instructions to follow. Just turn on and plug the USB adapter into the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Logitech knows electronics
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a small, lightweight presenter and laser pointer for your presentations? If so, look no further than the Logitech R400 wireless presenter. It is small, compact and handles easily. Well designed and very unobtrusive, it will help to give your presentations more impact.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Horne

customer_reviews.title: Good tech
customer_reviews.text: Fits my hand, works well, easy to hold and does it's job! Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jeffries, Speaker, Author

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this clicker because it fits well in my hand and is easy to use. I'm a teacher and it's a great plug-and-play tool for presentations with google slides or microsoft. Batteries last a long time in it too!
customer_reviews.author: giosmom

customer_reviews.title: This is the best thing that ever happened for my presentations
customer_reviews.text: Whoops. I just gave the review for this item to the case rather than this product. This is the best thing that ever happened for my presentations. It has a receiver for a usb port so I don't have to haul my lap top with me. I am able to plug it into my little stand alone projector and I'm on my way.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Gold

customer_reviews.title: Great with Powerpoint.
customer_reviews.text: This works great with Powerpoint. The "play" button starts the slides (another reviewer said you had to program this feature-- this isn't true any longer). And you can forward and reverse easily. I never am too awed by ergonomics. But this is impressive. It feels great in your hands. Fits naturally, the perfect size, and the texture of the device is slightly rubbery so easy to hang on to. The first time you plug the USB into a (PC) computer, it instantly installs the software and is ready to use. I am impressed how simple and intuitive this is. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSkyBlueSky

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. I used to it mostly for the pointer and a total of 6 times for some presentations using the PowerPoint. But it stopped working last month, I changed the batteries but it just stopped working. I expected better for the money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Z.

customer_reviews.title: A Simple Wireless Presenter
customer_reviews.text: Simple plug and play wireless presenter that works well with MS Power Point. Accidently, I found that this also changes pages on my Kindle app I downloaded on my PC. I've never used a wireless power point presenter so I can't make a comparison to other presenters. This presenter worked well for me. I liked the laser pointer build into the end as well. It is bright enough to be seen in a room with some ambient light.
customer_reviews.author: William Struse

customer_reviews.title: For my son the teacher
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted this to change his slides while he is teaching high school classes - he hated having to go up to the machine constantly (not wanting to turn his back on the students? Plus - interrupted his "flow" big time). He said this has changed his life. It is one of those things that if he loses it he will get another shipped overnight - that critical. This seems to have great range and function for the size classroom he teaches in. The size is very nice - it goes in his pocket I think. He travels between schools and hasn't lost it yet so I think it is not cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: NOT GENUINE! Not as pictured!
customer_reviews.text: I read and saw a picture on another review that this was not genuine. Didn't believe it since its one review and there is 2000+ reviews for this product. Well, maybe I am one of the unlucky buyer that got a fake product. Returning and buying from another. what a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Tan N.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get the one that is a model above this, which gives an LED readout of the battery life, but needed to save cash and went with this. I have no regrets. The battery seems to last a long time, and I just make sure to have two spare AAA nearby just in case. I've used it a few times in presentations, but I actually carry it around in my laptop bag and have grabbed it often to use the pointer while in meetings and things. I've got back problems, and this sure beats getting up, pointing, and usually having to lean over in order to do so (which is murder on my back). Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: James Duckett

customer_reviews.title: Great range, responsive, good laser pointer too
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of public speaking and presenting, and I love this device. It never leaves my work bag. It has great range, is responsive, the buttons feel like they're built to last and the laser pointer is strong enough. The USB dongle stores in the device, so it's not likely to disappear.
customer_reviews.author: engineering_enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching, SMARTBoard
customer_reviews.text: I love using this presenter as an elementary school teacher. I can control slideshows on my SMARTBoard (I have several that I do as drills on a daily basis), and the kids think the laser pointer is fun. The laser pointer also allows me to "untie" myself from the front of the room a bit and indicate while walking around the kids and monitoring for understanding. In hindsight, I wish I would have ponied up for the nicer version that has a built in timer. I am a special education teacher so I have distinct time periods that my lessons/groups fall into. The timer would allow me to discretely know when it's time to move on.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fieleke

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day and broke the cat
customer_reviews.text: Totally saved my boss's presentation then broke my friend's cat. Now he stares at the wall all day waiting for the red dot to appear.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Curtis

customer_reviews.title: this is the best wireless presenter available
customer_reviews.text: If you're an instructor or perform demonstrations, this is the best wireless presenter available. Its comfort and blend allows it to mold to your hand. I bought a cheap version a few years ago which fell apart. It was $5 so I expected that. Logitech makes the best PC peripherals for your daily usage. The battery lasts a long time and the USB transmitter attaches to the unit, so it doesn't get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Adam

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well, works every time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a whim to do some presentations and talks and it has held up. I've never had to replace batteries, it works on my MacBook Pro and my Surface RT and Surface PRO 4 without any issues. I'm always leery of little used devices dying/breaking or eating batteries when not used much but this has proven to be worth its price and work exactly as advertised. I always use in conjunction with PowerPoint myself.
customer_reviews.author: Byron D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great overall, but wish it had an auto-off feature
customer_reviews.text: I bought this quite a while ago and have liked it quite a bit overall. It works well, uses regular batteries, includes a laser pointer that is easy to use, the USB receiver fits snugly inside, and it comes with a nice carrying case. The only thing I don't like about it is that it has a manual on/of switch. My last one was auto on/off, so I'm continually forgetting to turn this one off when I use it. I'll definitely keep this one until it stops working, but the next time I buy one I'll make sure it comes with the auto off feature.
customer_reviews.author: TonyTop Contributor: The Lord of the Rings

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional presenter. Have used this so much I have worn out two sets of batteries and some of the button nomenclature. Doesn't matter. I have it memorized. Works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Bentwatertrail

customer_reviews.title: Great for effective presentation!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am universuty student and I've been using this pointer for presentations. Just in a few words: It's very usefull!!! WHy? First: Its very easy to install: Just plug USB reciever intp computer and you are ready to go!!! Second: Very compact: It is very small and very comfortable to hold and USB reciever can bw stored inside! which is very good. Third: It's fast: You just click and it responds instantly! No lags at all!!! Fourth: It looks good: There ar no cheap looking appearence so it looks pretty great!!! And Fifth: THE LASER POINTER!!! So if you want great pointer for study and work, This thing is for you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It also comes with a little pouch which is great if you need this to be portable
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a presenter remote. I thought originally that I did not get the USB adapter but it fits in the remote for safe storage. It also comes with a little pouch which is great if you need this to be portable. I was using it in a permanent install so those features were not that important to me but I think they are great for someone who needs this remote to be portable.
customer_reviews.author: James Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Love this device. Perfect for presentations, connects so easily. Just plug it in and turn it on. Once you have PowerPoint open, put it in presentation mode, and this dandy device will switch slides seamlessly. Nice that it has a laser pointer so you can point at the screen from a distance. (also fun to play with the cats with.) It also has a button to switch between screens, but I haven't gotten the hang of it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Catsanova Von Diddlesworth

customer_reviews.title: What Did I Ever Do Without This?
customer_reviews.text: Freed from the tyranny of the computer controls I can now move around my audience for presentations - adding an interactive dynamic that makes me look like a real pro.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: I used this during the class I taught this summer, and I absolutely love how simple and sleek it is. If you're not looking for a super high-tech one with functions beyond the forward/backward, black screen toggle, and laser pointer, then this is your baby! I also like how the USB receiver fits inside the presenter :) It's the size of a full USB thumb-drive, though - about 1.5" long - which is the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars; the hard drives of the computers in our classrooms are just about shin/knee level by the podium, and I seriously feared knocking into the USB receiver and breaking it!
customer_reviews.author: smyhelee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great product design
customer_reviews.text: The product design is almost too good! I spent 15 minutes trying to find the usb adapter, I even started to write a negative review. But I realized that the usb actually came out of the presenter/clicker from the bottom. It was easy to use and I had no problem setting it up with my mac book.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works like you would expect it to work.
customer_reviews.text: We have only tried it on two laptops but in both cases it performed perfectly. Plug in the usb receiver and the driver is loaded automatically and the remote is ready to control your powerpoint. The built in laser is also a nice touch. It was getting too painful to watch our managers run their quarterly employee meeting being tethered to the laptop or relying on someone else to advance the slides. The receiver is fairly large, which helps you remember to take it out when you are done, but cause one executive to wonder why he could load his powerpoint on the usb flash drive that was now there. It made for a funny story to pass along.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works well; loose battery cover
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great remote, except for two issues. First, the battery cover is extremely loose and won’t stay on unless I tape it. Second, the symbols on the buttons wear off. That said, I’ve dropped it numerous times and it’s still working.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Menicucci

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool Device
customer_reviews.text: For me, this works much better than the remote for the digital projector. It's essentially a tiny wireless keyboard that has only the few buttons that you need to run a PowerPoint, and as a bonus it has a laser pointer. There are also a couple of buttons that are very handy. One blacks out the screen and one returns from that function. This allows the presenter to get everyone's attention off the screen and back to what he is saying. Others have commented that there are limited functions. I say "GREAT", it has only what I need. Talk about simple to use, just plug and go.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bushman

customer_reviews.title: Ready to Hand
customer_reviews.text: This remote is a great size. I suspect that all remotes will do what they say because the technology is rather straightforward. The difference is the comfort of the remote. I typically give 1-2 hour PowerPoint presentations and may do two in a day. It is important to me that the remote is large enough to use without pressing the wrong key, yet small enough to feel comfortable and to slip into a jacket pocket. This one certainly fills the bill and does exactly what the manufacturer says it will do. Nice job, Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Family

customer_reviews.title: very nice presenter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this when I was in a conference and had it delivered to the hotel. The package is what you'd expect from Logitech. I like the clicky buttons that give you very responsive feedback. The laser pointer is bright enough. If you could spare another 20 bucks or so, you can get a pro version. Basically, you get a timer that reminds you by vibration and a green, more power laser. For me, this one is perfectly fine. One thing I don't like is the receiver. I won't expect a uni-receiver, but a smaller one would be nice. Anyways, you will only use it once in a while, the big receiver isn't a big hassle.
customer_reviews.author: RussellWilson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wireless presenter. I have used this in my classroom, and it has been a lifesaver! I can move all around the room and present without distraction. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly C.

customer_reviews.title: Not that useful..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a larger room where the computer is near the half point of the room. It doesn't reach that far so it seems kind of pointless... In order to use it I have to stand closer to the computer. I was hoping this would be better. I'm going to try to move some things around and see if it helps
customer_reviews.author: JLO

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 35 uses. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it January 19th. Used it for 20 minute presentations for exactly 35 presentation dates. Tried using it yesterday (April 8th) and it won't work. The red laser light works but not the slide advancing. Changed batteries but still no use. When it did work, it was great. But worthless if it only lasts 2 months. Don't bother with this unit unless you are looking for short term use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice presenter that fits well in the hand
customer_reviews.text: Nice presenter that fits well in the hand. Decent laser. Uses inexpensive AAA batteries instead of expensive watch batteries like in my old presenter. My only gripe with the Logitech is that the laser button is next to the forward-reverse buttons, allowing me to mistakenly advance or reverse my presentation slides when I really wanted to use the laser. My old presenter had a laser button far from the slide selector buttons, which I liked. Still, this Logitech works reliably, even across a large lecture hall from over 50 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great 'remote'
customer_reviews.text: I studied many Amazon product reviews before making this purchase, and based this purchase on the reviews I read. So glad I took the advice of other purchasers -- It's everything the other 5-star reviewers said it is! Two things I especially like: first, the forward/backward keys are placed beside one another, unlike other remote presentation clickers I've used which have them above/below each other (which is somehow counterintuitive when you're using the thing). Second, it doesn't fly out of my hand when I'm gesturing in the classroom, which other remotes I've used are likely to do. Excellent product, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Spinningshields

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, who recently discovered the wonderful world of Powerpoint. She converted her entire 7th grade science curriculum into a Powerpoint presentation (she's a teacher) on the smartboard in her class. That she doesn't have to stand by her computer to change slides was a HUGE plus for her. She's usually not into my buying technology for her, but this changed her whole teaching life, she can walk around the class and interact with the kids. It's the greatest thing for her since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Shacalo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one, and I’ve taken them all over the world. I would strongly advise against dropping it on a concrete floor in Kabul, Afghanistan, but other than that it is a great and durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan-T-Man

customer_reviews.title: I find this Presenter better for its laser pointer (works against all screens and ...
customer_reviews.text: Super-easy and well made. I had had a Belkin version for three years which finally gave out on me. I find this Presenter better for its laser pointer (works against all screens and has long-distance strength). One minor option I liked on the Belkin was that it worked on only one AAA battery which had space for a 'spare' if the battery needed replaced immediately. But, the options for communicating with the PowerPoint presentation and to show a blank screen when necessary are genuinely appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Ontheroad

customer_reviews.title: DOES'T work well with USB-C DONGLES
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use with MacBook Pro 2017, the one with only usb-c. tried to use this presenter with various dongles. It barely works. You need stand VERY VERY close to your dongle and let the Logitech usb "see" your presenter, otherwise it is just a pointer. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Worcester

customer_reviews.title: Very easy, great portfolio
customer_reviews.text: This presenter installed with no problems, and immediately I was able to control any of my PowerPoint slides. I would consider this a must-have tool for any organization that does presentations, whether internally, or as a option for outside speakers. I handle the position of A/V tech for our local chamber of commerce, and our monthly guests find this very easy to use. The range is superb in an open meeting space (60+ feet). For anything over a greater distance, I would either consider the next model up, or move the USB receiver closer with a USB extender.
customer_reviews.author: Sean A

product_meta.title: Logitech Wireless Presenter R400, Wireless Presentation Remote Clicker with Laser Pointer
product_meta.description:
Use the highly efficient controls of this wireless presenter to help you make your point and boost your confidence during your next presentation. 2.4 GHz wireless connectivity lets you move freely up to 50' away from the receiver to provide the freedom to move around the room and mingle with your audience for greater impact. Intuitive slideshow controls are easy to find by touch for a smooth, simple way to navigate through each slide. Bright-red laser pointer makes it easy for your audience to see exactly what you're pointing to. Battery indicator allows you to quickly see how much power is available with just a glance. And with plug-and-play technology, simply plug in the receiver into a USB port to begin. When the show is over, just place the receiver back in the presenter, and you're ready to go. System Requirements: Windows XP Windows Vista|USB port.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Logitech wireless presenter R400
feature_bullets: Presenter mode,built in class 2 laser pointer, intuitive touch keys for easy slideshow control; AA batteries required (best with Polaroid AA batteries)
Bright red laser pointer: Easy to see against most backgrounds
Up to 50 foot wireless range for freedom to move around the room
2.4 GHz RF wireless technology, built in docking bay stores receiver for easy pack up and portability
There’s no software to install: Just plug the receiver into a USB port to begin: And when the show is over, you can store the receiver in the presenter
